area_name: 1 - The Arete Wall (aka Rock One Area)

content.description: Stand start bottom right of the West face, left hand on the face, right hand on the arete. Follow the arete/rail up through some positive holds moving up and left. Climb diagnol left until you hit the obvious ledge about 13ft up and go straight up through cruiser terrain to the top from the ledge.
content.location:
Lower right (South end) on the West face of the "Rock One" formation. 

  Its the face and arete just right of the obvious front block that is seen in the photos for the "rock one" area.

content.description: Start on the West facing side of the arête.  Climb straight up the arête to the top.  Stay on the face proper, the arête and the corner is off limits.

Start on the North facing side of the arête.  Climb up the face angling left to a slightly overhanging fist sized crack that angles to the left, climb the crack to its end and then finish by climbing straight up to the top.

Start in the inside corner of the West face and the huge block in front of the face.  Climb up the inside corner, then continue through an offwidth crack to the top.  The crux is the transition from the inside corner to the offwidth crack tending to the right.  To make it a bit sporty, try not to step off onto the top of the huge block!

Start on the North facing side of the arête.  Climb straight up the slightly overhanging arête through a ½ inch finger crack to the top.  Stay on the face proper, around the corner of the arête is off limits. 

  Note:  If you stick all of the holds in sequence it is an excellent 5.7 climb, otherwise it can be very hard!

pathTokens: 1 - The Arete Wall (aka Rock One Area)

content.description: There is a crag located at the far right hand side of the White Rocks outcrop.   Its overall height is approximately thirty-five (35) vertical feet.  It is just twenty five (25) yards from the upper parking lot and the road.  It features an impresssive North / West facing slightly overhanging arête with some excellent crack and face climbing.  It also has a huge block in front of the crag that sports some great bouldering.
